definition: to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: Gathering them unemotionally will help those facts come out.
sentences.chinese: 非情緒化地收集事實會幫助那些事實浮出水面。

sentences.english: As I said earlier, Cancer woman is extremely moody.
sentences.chinese: 正像我剛纔說的，巨蟹女是極其情緒化的。
情緒化的投資向來沒有好下場。

sentences.english: Emotional, but will not back-stab others.
sentences.chinese: 情緒化，但不會背後捅刀子。

sentences.english: This way, he can avoid becoming emotional or appear not to be in control.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，他就能避免變得情緒化，或似乎不會受到控制。

sentences.english: She is moody and gets depressed easily, especially when somebody cheats her.
sentences.chinese: 她情緒化，很容易鬱悶，尤其是被欺騙時。

sentences.english: Isn't it just more emotionalism, more wishful thinking?
sentences.chinese: 難道這種想法不更加情緒化和天真麼？

sentences.english: The Cancer is more emotional creature but they are capable to feel pleasure from their relationships.
sentences.chinese: 巨蟹座更加情緒化，但能從他們的關係中得到快樂。

sentences.english: You do not allow yourself to become emotionally reactive to events that take place.
sentences.chinese: 你不會讓自己對發生的事情作出情緒化的反應。

sentences.english: Display the words and deeds are living with emotional and tendentious .
sentences.chinese: 顯示生活的言行都是帶有情緒化和傾向性的。

sentences.english: It immerses you in the atmosphere which is comfortable and full of emotional strain .
sentences.chinese: 它讓您沉浸在氣氛是舒適和充滿情緒化的壓力。

sentences.english: It's tempting to react impulsively or emotionally when faced with a business decision.
sentences.chinese: 在面對商業決策時會誘使反應衝動或情緒化。

sentences.english: But emotional eating can sabotage your weight-loss efforts.
sentences.chinese: 但情緒化進食會妨害爲減肥所做出的努力。

sentences.english: The debate in America over health-care reform turned rancorous.
sentences.chinese: 美國關於醫療改革的爭論已經變得情緒化了。

sentences.english: He is always rather demonstrative, and Saturday was no different.
sentences.chinese: 他總是相當的情緒化，這個星期六也不例外。

sentences.english: You may be more  emotional than usual.
sentences.chinese: 你可能會比平常更加情緒化。

definition: now hot, now cold/(of one's mood, affection etc) to alternate
to be softhearted/to be tenderhearted/to be kindhearted
slow in one's reactions/sluggish (in movement or thought)
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to indulge in flights of fancy (idiom)/to let one's imagination run wild
Virgo (constellation and sign of the zodiac)/popular variant of 室女座[Shi4 nu:3 zuo4]
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
